text:
i add scope 'content' in oath 2.0 procees but i am no acessing marketing emails
what is problem ?

Is there a way to detect the language set by the editing user on the edit page? I'm trying to set a label for a dnd module in a template,
e.g. {% dnd_module path='@HubSpot/rich_text' label='Body Text' %} Then have the label be different if user editor language = French. I know I can create translations in custom modules, but I can't find documentation on how to detect what's triggering that translation, so I can't use it directly in a template
Thanks for the reply! That seemed like a good solution. But looking at it now, I don't think so. The form notification can only be sent to a user set up on your portal not any possible email address

<@U7SL518D6> <@UD53A9UUR> Ive noticed this on a few portals now — but since some updates were made to the page editor UI (Likely since the rollout of the new sections feature) Ive noticed that sometimes I am locked out of selecting a section in a DND interface. I am able to still select modules but I dont get any kind of highlight or anything. But once I select the modules I cannot then try to back out of the module and select a section in order to edit the background-color or width etc without reloading the page again.

We recently updated the UI in the page editor <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/usability-and-interface-improvements-for-the-page-editor>

Did you notice this issue only after this update?
Can you DM me the page editor link for the page you’re experiencing this in?
and into the shady dm territory they go.  never to be seen again :scream:
Lol. Well good news everyone the issue is being resolved.

After a lengthy, discreet, discussion — where nothing evil took place and nothing happened that should worry anyone - and no palms were greased - and everything was totally legit — jon says a fix is in place

Hey all, I'm just looking to update my home page by publishing a revised version of it but when I try to publish the new version to the home page URL it instead published to a temporary slug.

My support agent directed me here. Anyone wanna point me in the right direction?
Hey there can you send me the support ticket ID?

Hi everyone, didn’t see a specific support channel so apologies in advance if this isn’t the right channel. I just did the tutorial to get started, following the instructions here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/getting-started>

I’m able to create a page and publish, but when visiting it, I get the following error, any thoughts or help would be appreciated, thank you!

`Our website provider is having trouble loading this page.`
`They're working on resolving the issue. Thank you for your patience.`
`In the meantime, you can refresh this page or go back to the previous page.`
Hey there, if you are still experiencing this issue, I encourage you to contact support. <http://help.HubSpot.com|help.HubSpot.com>
